project.name: Arduino on Cloud
project.summary: Arduino on Cloud is a open source web-based system for designing and simulating Arduino circuits by FOSSEE (Free/Libre and Open Source Software for Education), IIT Bombay

contributions.organization: Free/Libre and Open Source Software for Education, Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay
contribution: Save Arduino Circuits in json format which can be downloaded and be uploaded back to platform to continue the left developement
Frontend for setting an Arduino circuit in LMS using LTI.
Designed form to set LTI related details, final Arduino circuit and boilerplate Arduino circuit.
Made Arduino simulation page visible on LMS platform.
Modified Django Backend to store voltage levels from Arduino pins useful for autograding assignments conducted using this platform on LMS.

projects.title: curabl
about: A virtual clinic for doctors to address the patients' issues (physically/virtually)
A virtual clinic for doctors to give them proper medication / prescription (digital/downloadable)
A virtual clinic for doctors to give consultation and collaborate with professionals to discuss patients' issues (virtually)
contribution: Frontend and Backend for storing, searching and presenting profile of doctors and their patients
Handled database queries for storing doctor's and patient's information
Added multi-lingual support to platform
Hosted the project using Azure Virtual Machines and .me domain
Hosted and integrated third party chat service - RocketChat

projects.title: Canteen Automation System
about: A food serivce app to automate or digitize the food ordering process @college canteen
contribution: Designed database queries and backend.
Developed API for CRUD operations on food items
Added feature of cart to store food items to be ordered.

projects.title: Scheduling algorithms in xv6 os
about: Changed the default Round Robin scheduling algorithm in xv6 os to Lottery, Preemptive Priority, FCFS, Multilevel Feedback Queue
contribution: Implemented Lottery and Priority Scheduling algorithms in xv6-os.
Developed sample programs to test correctness of implemented algorithms.
Added supportive system calls (nice, ps) for testing and analysis of scheduling algorithms.

projects.title: PyBrowser
about: Mimic web browser with basic features
contribution: Webpages from requested URL are rendered.
Browsing History is maintained and can be traversed to and fro.
Rendered webpages and downloadable files can be downloaded.
Websites can be opened in multiple tabs.

projects.title: grep command
about: Cloning Global Regular Expression Print (grep) command in linux.
contribution: Searches pattern in a file and recursively in a directory and prints all the lines containing the pattern.
Implemented options b,c,f,h,H,i,m,q,r,v,w

projects.title: HTTP Server
contribution: Implemented and tested HTTP GET request.
Extended client-server communication from command line to browser.
Implemented logging of incoming requests and events.
